RETIRED SGT. RONALD J McDONNELL

*** 50 Year FOP # 5 Member (1972 to Present) ***

Badge Nos : # 1845 ; Sgt’s Badge # 412

Appointment date : August, 1972

Phila. Police Academy Class # 227

Assigned December, 1972 to : P / O 24th District ( 1973 - 1974 ).

Subsequent assignments: K - 9 training ; K - 9 patrol officer - 24th District; Sgt. - 25th Distict ; Police Academy firing range safety instructor ; Special Victims Unit ( SVU ) - South / Pattinson Ave., west of Broad St. ; PAB - Reports Control.

Retirement date : 2005

Date of Death : November 11th, 2023

Brother of Retired Lt. William P. McDonnell, Sr. ( Badge # ) and Retired Detective James D. McDonnell ( Badge # 9183 ) ;

Also, Ron McDonnell was a Retired ( after 21+ years of service ) Chief Petty Officer, U.S. Navy Reserve, attached to Willow Grove Naval Air Station in Horsham, PA.

The family welcomes friends to join in a celebration of Ron’s life on November 30, 2023 from 5:00PM to 7:00PM at the Joseph A. Fluehr III Funeral Home, 241 East Butler Ave. (at Sandy Ridge Rd.) New Britain, PA 18901. On December 1, 2023relatives and friends are again invited to greet the family from 10:00AM until his Funeral Mass at 11:00AM at Our Lady of the Sacred Heart Catholic Church, 100 Broad St. Hilltown, PA 18927. Interment will take place at Washington Crossing National Cemetery with military honors.

John "Jack" Walder, 72 - of West Wildwood, NJ passed away on February 21,2023 after a long battle with lymphoma and kidney disease. He fought hard and never complained. Jack was born in Phildelphia, PA to the late John and Marie Walder. He loved hanging on the corner with his friends in Oxford Circle. He graduated from Cardinal Dougherty High School in Philly and then attended the police academy. He served with the Philadelphia Police Department for 25 years where he received their highest honor. He also served in the Army Reserves. After a stint as a Jack-of-AII-Trades at Christ the King Elementary School in Philadelphia, Jack joined the Bucks County Sheriffs Departmentwhere he worked as a deputy for 13 years. He retired in 2013 to enjoy fishing, golfing, scuba diving, and happy hours. Although Jack was generally quiet, he was known for his witty comments and sly smile.

He is survived by his wife of nineteen years, Mary Ellen Walder; his children; Jaclyn Jerzakand Christopher Walder; and his stepchildren: Patricia Moore, Thomas Moore (Kelsey DeCercio), and Brad Moore. He leaves behind his beloved grandchildren, Gavin and Isadore Jerzak.

Jack has three siblings: Maria Roesener (Bill), Eileen Boulden, and Jim Walder (Regina). He is also survived by numerous cousins, nieces, nephews, and good friends.

Jack visitation will be held on Friday, February 24,2023 from 6 to 8 p.m. at Radzieta Funeral Home, 9 Hand Avenue, Cape May Court House, NJ 08260; and on Saturday, February 25,2023 from 10 to 10:45 a.m. at St. Ann's Catholic Church, 2901 Atlantic Avenue, Wildwood, NJ 08260. Mass will follow at 11 a.m. Everyone is invited to a luncheon to reminisce and celebrate Jack's life. This will beheld atThe Shore Club, 1170 Golf Club Road, Cape May Court House, NJ; immediately following the Funeral Mass.

In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the Lazarus House Emergency Food Pantry, PO Box 1792, Wildwood, NJ 08260.
